com.snap2d.world
Class Entity

java.lang.Object
  com.snap2d.world.Entity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
public abstract class Entity
extends Object
implements Renderable

Represents an object in the 2-dimensional world space. Entity provides a base implementation for all objects that exist in the world.

Author:
Brian Groenke

Constructor Detail

Entity

public Entity(Rectangle2D worldBounds,
              World2D world)
Creates this Entity at the given world location in the context of the given World2D. The screen bounds are calculated using the World2D, converting the world location to a screen location and setting the size based on pixels-per-unit.

Parameters:
worldBounds - the bounding box for the entity in world space
world - the World2D this Entity exists in; used for converting coordinates and determining world/screen position.

setScreenLoc

public void setScreenLoc(int nx,
                         int ny)
Sets the location of this Entity on the screen coordinate system. Supertype implementation simply resets the world/screen points and bounds. Overriding subclasses can call through to super for convenience.

Parameters:
newLoc -

setWorldLoc

public void setWorldLoc(double nx,
                        double ny)
Sets the location of this Entity on the world coordinate system. Supertype implementation simply resets the world/screen points and bounds. Overriding subclasses can call through to super for convenience.

collidesWith

public boolean collidesWith(Entity e)

setAllowRender

public abstract void setAllowRender(boolean render)
Set whether or not the Entity should be rendered on screen. The behavior of this method is entirely up to the implementation.

Parameters:
render -

getPhysics

public abstract GamePhysics getPhysics()
Obtain the GamePhysics node of the Entity, if one exists.

Returns:

getCollisionModel

public abstract CollisionModel getCollisionModel()
Obtain the collision model of the Entity. This should always return a valid CollisionModel for all Entity implementations. Null values will cause errors in collision and bounds checking.

Returns:
the Entity's CollisionModel
